thread.title: Emmerdale actress Natalie J. Robb confesses she was homeless and forced to sleep in her car
thread.title_full: Emmerdale actress Natalie J. Robb confesses she was homeless and forced to sleep in her car

author: Jessica Gibb
title: Emmerdale actress Natalie J. Robb confesses she was homeless and forced to sleep in her car
text:
Emmerdale actress Natalie J. Robb confesses she was homeless and forced to sleep in her car Soap actress opened up about money troubles Share Emmerdale actress Natalie J Robb (Photo: ITV) Share Get   Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Emmerdale actress Natalie J. Robb has revealed that she was left homeless and was even forced to sleep in her car after moving to London. 
Natalie, who plays Moira Dingle in the ITV soap, has opened up about how difficult it was to break into the acting world. 
The 42-year-old actress moved from her native Scotland to London to follow her dream. Natalie J. Robb plays Moira Dingle in Emmerdale (Photo: ITV) 
But when she relocated to the big city, Natalie admitted she struggled to make ends meet. 
“I was OK, but I lived in my car for a couple of weeks when I first came down,” she told The Sunday Post . 
“I was due to stay with my cousin but he had another lodger meaning I couldn’t stay straight away so I just slept in my car. Times were tough when Natalie J. Robb started out (Photo: Getty Images Europe) 
“I didn’t mind – I just thought it was all part of the experience.” 
Natalie is now one of the favourites on the ITV soap and is glad she followed her dreams. 
“I looked up to the sky to ask the universe and thought I’m going to do this and follow this dream and if it doesn’t work, it doesn’t work but, back me up, will you?” she said. Natalie J Robb told Loose Women recent scenes left her in tears (Photo: ITV) 
Last year, Natalie revealed that the shocking death scene with Sophie Powles was so emotional she was left in tears. 
Appearing on This Morning , the soap star opened up about filming the moment which left fans devastated with no prior warning of the storyline outcome. 
Natalie, who plays Moira Dingle the mother of Holly Barton, in the show said: "On the day I didn't really know what I was going to do with it. I wanted to honour it the best I could, it's my job to try and be a storyteller as it hasn't actually happened to me. (Photo: ITV) 
"Just to make sure I hit the right notes and send out the right message. It's a reality it happens." 
She added of Sophie's last scenes: "That was sad, when I did the scene with her, when I cradled her, she was so good at staying still and playing dead. Then right after when they yelled 'cut' she just burst into tears. 
“We both just sat there and continued sobbing, because it was the end for us and she said it was so sad for her to hear." Like us on Facebook
